chapter.title: Management interface layout
chapter.para: Here is a screenshot of the PMB management interface. The screen is divided into three sections.
This allows for the switching between the different management interface modules at any time.
Only the modules for which the user has access are displayed.
To the right of the navigation bar, at the same level as the tabs, can be found different links : history,?, edit your account, opac, and Logout.

history opens in an iframe (block on the screen) a history of the searches carried out in the PMB management interface. This link is only displayed if you have the access rights to the catalogue tab. For more information about searches, see ; for more information about search history, see .

? allows access to PMB's context sensitive help. For more information, read the chapter . The displaying or not of contextual help is parametrised. For more information, consult the PMB Administrator Guide, chapter Utils, section Parameters.
edit your account allows access to the preferences of the user connected to PMB.
opac opens a new browser window and displays the OPAC
logout disconnects the current user, and returns to the login screen
This provides access to the different functions within each module.
The central interface is the part of PMB in which you can input or edit information, execute functions, validate updates, etc.
